definition: Euclid of Alexandria (c. 300 BC), Greek geometer and author of Elements 幾何原本|几何原本
(used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: In the case of non-Euclidean geometry he published no definitive work.
sentences.chinese: 至於非歐幾里德幾何，他沒有發表過權威性的著作。

sentences.english: Euclid requires no prior study of mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 讀歐幾里德不需要先研究數學。

sentences.english: The common conclusion was the uniqueness and necessity of Euclidean geometry .
sentences.chinese: 歐幾里德幾何的唯一性與必要性已被公認。
